slides.title: Introduction
content: Hi, I’m Samuel Nana Boohene Akuffo. I’m passionate about bridging business objectives with scalable technology solutions. By combining systems thinking with technical expertise, I design tools that drive efficiency and enable smarter decision-making.

slides.title: Experience
content: I’ve gained hands-on experience in corporate and university settings. At GIHOC Distilleries, I optimized SQL databases to reduce processing time and improve reporting accuracy, analyzed market trends to guide product launches, and conducted consumer testing. At GWU, I support athletics marketing and ESPN+ broadcasts, coordinating game-day operations, managing graphics, and analyzing engagement metrics. I’ve also helped streamline student access to DC Metro services with GW Transport.

slides.title: Skills
content: I bring a range of technical and analytical skills to every project. From Python, JavaScript, and SQL to Flask, React, and Docker, I leverage technology to solve complex business challenges. My experience also spans analytics, visualization, cloud applications, and full-stack development.

slides.title: Passions
content: I’m fascinated by architecture, both in systems and in the physical world. I enjoy exploring how thoughtful, well-designed structures whether in code or buildings can create more efficient, elegant, and human-centered solutions.

slides.title: Interests
content: Beyond technology, I explore music production, sound design, and human behavior. These passions inspire creativity and problem-solving, fueling my work in tech with a more human and intuitive approach.
